required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Optimizing Mothers' Milk for Preterm Infants (OptiMoM) Program of Research: Study 1-Impact of Donor Milk at Kindergarten

brief_summary.textblock: In Canada, the leading cause of long-term disability in children is being born at very low birth weight (VLBW). To help improve outcomes, nutrition is a modifiable aspect of infant care. Mother's milk is the optimal way to feed VLBW infants; however, many need a supplement of donor milk or preterm formula as not enough mother's milk is available. As the ideal supplement for prolonged feeding and its long-term effects is currently unknown, this study is a prospective follow up of VLBW infants who in hospital were fed: donor milk or preterm formula and/or mother's milk. Areas of development to be assessed include: cognition, language, motor skills, brain structure/function, and body composition. A DNA biorepository will also be created.

primary_outcome.measure: Full-Scale IQ on the Wechsler Preschool and Primary Scale of Intelligence-IV (WPPSI-IV)

secondary_outcome.measure: General Language Composite on the WPPSI-IV
Processing Speed Quotient on the WPPSI-IV

secondary_outcome.description: Growth as assessed using weight, height and waist circumference measurements.
Body composition as assessed using the COSMED BOD POD and skinfold thickness.

other_outcome.measure: Affect Recognition domain on the NEPSY-II

other_outcome.description: Development of brain structure as assessed using Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI).
Development of brain function as assessed using Magnetoencephalography (MEG).

other_outcome.measure: Interaction of genetic differences and feeding type on outcomes
other_outcome.description: Assessed using a buccal cell biorepository.

other_outcome.measure: Influence of the diet on epigenetic changes
other_outcome.description: Assessed using a buccal cell biorepository.

other_outcome.measure: School Readiness using the Early Development Instrument (EDI)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Children previously assigned to donor milk in the DoMINO trial
arm_group.description: This study is an observational study of children who were enrolled in a previous trial (DoMINO trial) between 2010 and 2012 during which they were randomized to receive donor milk when mother's own breastmilk was unavailable. Donor milk was from a milk bank part of the Human Milk Banking Association of North America (HMBANA).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Children previously assigned to formula in the DoMINO trial
arm_group.description: This study is an observational study of children who were enrolled in a previous trial (DoMINO trial) between 2010 and 2012 during which they were randomized to receive preterm formula when mother's own breastmilk was unavailable. Preterm formula was either Similac Special Care or Enfamil Premature depending on hospital contract with formula companies.

intervention.arm_group_label: Children previously assigned to donor milk in the DoMINO trial
Children previously assigned to formula in the DoMINO trial

study_pop.textblock: Very low birth weight infants previously enrolled in the DoMINO (Donor Milk for Improved Neurodevelopmental Outcomes) trial (ISRCTN35317141).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children who were enrolled in the DoMINO (Donor Milk for Improved Neurodevelopmental Outcomes) trial (ISRCTN35317141).

link.description: Donor Milk for Improved Neurodevelopmental Outcomes (DoMINO) trial
